item.title: Regression models: a cheat-sheet
item.description: One model to rule them all Regression models, aka linear regression models or linear models, are a group of statistical models based on the simple idea that we can predict an outcome variable \(Y\) based on a function \(f(X)\). The “simplest” regression model is the formula of a line:1 \[ y = \alpha + \beta x \] where \(\alpha\) is the intercept of the line and \(\beta\) the slope.
